summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel and Department of Justice (CRT, ODAG) staff coordinating the distribution of invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a meeting with victims/survivors of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss logistics, contact lists, attorney representation, and document clearance.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Mentioned as the source of a list of clients/victims. Appears to be an FBI Victim Services staff member providing contact information.

persons.name: Bob Josefverg
persons.context: Mentioned as the source from whom the most recent list of clients is being obtained. Role is unclear from context.

connections.description: Brittany Henderson is obtaining a client list from Bob Josefverg, indicating a professional workflow or reporting relationship.

events.title: Planned Victim/Survivor Meeting
events.description: A meeting is being organized for victims/survivors of Jeffrey Epstein. Invitations and RSVP questionnaires are being distributed via email to attorneys and some victims directly.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division and DOJ were coordinating a meeting for Epstein victims/survivors scheduled for November 12, 2020.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
A master list of victims/clients was maintained, with some contact information red-highlighted indicating missing details.
The correspondence highlights logistical challenges in reaching victims, including outdated attorney information and lack of direct contact details.
